Description: Fragment of shoulder of Attic black-figured pottery open vase (dinos?). Inside glazed. Outside: at top, tongues (traces of red on three alternating tongues), above battlement frieze; in frieze, bird (wing, tail, part of body) to left; to its right, part of a round shield with traces of red on the rim and down-pointing spear-head; to left indeterminate remains.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

A sherd in Oxford, AN1896-1908-G137.13, with a cavalcade of horsemen is almost certainly from the same vase, though the inside glaze is less streaky and the drawing less careful. Duel scene? Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 55, pl. 32, 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0858)
